title: | Video | Sports Wrap: Australia dictate terms in Pune Test, Leicester sack manager Claudio Ranieri | Sports Videos | - India Today
text:
Feedback 
India lost seven wickets for just 11 runs and were bowled out for 105 as Steve O'Keefe ran riot, snaring six wickets for 35 including three wickets in one single over where he sent KL Rahul, Ajinkya Rahane and Wriddhiman Saha packing. Australia reached 143/4 on Day 2 with a commanding lead of 298 runs in Pune. Earlier in the week, England all-rounder Ben Stokes became the second costliest player in the history of IPL auctions when the Rising Pune Supergiants bought him for Rs 14.5 crore while fast bowler Tymal Mills was sold for a whopping 12 crore to the Royal Challengers Bangalore.In other sports news, Premier League champions Leicester City sacked Italian manager Claudio Ranieri on Thursday, nine months after he clinched one of soccer's most remarkable triumphs but with the team now hovering above the relegation zone. Watch Right Now
